result.reason: Default inheritance settings are explicitly disabled in Settings.settings, causing new connections to ignore parent properties by default. This confirms the user report.
result.approach: Modify Settings.settings to set 'InhDefault' values to True for common properties (User, Password, Domain, Protocol, etc.) to enable inheritance by default.

attempts.raw_output:
Based on the analysis of Issue #1084 "Inheritance issue", the primary complaint is that inheritance is not enabled by default for new connections, and there are inconsistencies in what is inherited. A review of `mRemoteNG\Properties\Settings.settings` confirms that all `InhDefault...` properties (e.g., `InhDefaultUsername`, `InhDefaultProtocol`) are set to `False`. This causes `DefaultConnectionInheritance` to initialize new connections with inheritance disabled, forcing users to manually enable it for every property.

```json
{
"decision": "implement",
"reason": "Default inheritance settings are explicitly disabled in Settings.settings, causing new connections to ignore parent properties by default. This confirms the user report.",
"priority": "P3-enhancement",
"estimated_files": ["mRemoteNG/Properties/Settings.settings", "mRemoteNG/Connection/DefaultConnectionInheritance.cs"],
"approach": "Modify Settings.settings to set 'InhDefault' values to True for common properties (User, Password, Domain, Protocol, etc.) to enable inheritance by default."
}
```
